reviews.sentence: I loved the panoramic view you got from your balcony. Every scene was vibrant and magical. The staff was efficient in every wayMy bed was a bit too firm but the day bed was available and worked out well.

Great Customer Service. Staff are incredible. From the maintenance staff to front desk to bar we had great service. Nice rooms with big private front porches and comfy beds. Good showers. Nice food. Everything was great. Downtown within walking distance botanical gardens great hotsprings. A bit confusing trying to find your way around but it was not an issue.
Exceptional. Excellent location on the waterfront and walking distance to the ferry. Great staff and a good price for such a hotel category.

I have been to Fort Young Hotel on many occasions weddings bridal prep day passes and birthday celebrations to name a few. My experience has been consistent through and through courteous staff amazing food and an overall great time. I will continue to patronize the Fort Young Hotel and would advise any visitors or locals who have never had a chance to indulge themselves in everything that the hotel has to offer.

Lovely hotel great staff. Expect to see large ships daily during high season. The hotel is very nice. Being a diver having a diving company on site is fantastic. All staff were very helpful and friendly. Nothing. Only thing that could put people off would be large ships docking right in front of the hotel deterring from the sea view.

Comfortable property in a great location. Fort Young Hotel is centrally located in the town of Roseau. We had a lovely room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The bedding was comfortable and the room clean. The staff were very friendly and always acknowledged you when walking through the property. The property has a delightful bar lounge area which is nice to relax in after a day of sightseeing.

Comfortable Stay. The service was good and staff very friendly. I have an average for condition as the hotel is under renovation. The new restaurant upstairs is very impressive. However i think automatic doors are needed between the veranda and inside eating area. It is really difficulty to navigate a plate of food and drink and try to open the doors when going in for the breakfast buffet.
Great location friendly staff and clean comfortable rooms. The restaurant is a bit slow so order early.

The ambience was nice but the service needs to be improved. My burger arrived cold after all the other dishes at my table had been served. Further the bill had to be redone twice before the items on it were correct.
Positive experience. Specifically the customer service from Albert and the lovely girl with the locks both from the restaurant.

Ft Young Hotel Roseau Dominica. The property is historic and beautiful. The rooms are comfortable spacious and have a great view of the sea from the balconyI did n’t appreciate the occasional flying insects that hover around the sink bathroom area. But on a tropical island what is to be expected right‍ ♂ ️ The housekeeping staff did a decent job but I believe that fresh towels and ENOUGH bathroom tissue should be a priority not an option. Also the television which comes in handy when you have small children in the room on a rainy day and it WILL RAIN has really poor service as does the WiFi. Really bad WiFi service in a fairly expensive hotel room is a big problem and should be addressed and rectified.

But on a tropical island what is to be expected right‍ ♂ ️ The housekeeping staff did a decent job but I believe that fresh towels and ENOUGH bathroom tissue should be a priority not an option. Also the television which comes in handy when you have small children in the room on a rainy day and it WILL RAIN has really poor service as does the WiFi. Really bad WiFi service in a fairly expensive hotel room is a big problem and should be addressed and rectified.

Beautiful hotel bad service. The place is beautiful and right by the sea. Location is perfect and the place is quiet and nice wifi works well. There were several problems with the service. When I did not have hot water it took 15 hours to resolve. Trying to pay room service fees also took a couple of hours the staff was leaving the room door open and gave wrong instructions that would have led to double pay as they did not cooperate with the front desk. When waiting for the room to check in I was told that it was ready when it was not which made me return from the restaurant and several smaller things. The beauty of the place compensates a lot but during a work trip these kind of things are inconvenient.

We stopped there for lunch on a Sunday. it was THREE hours to get service and get food. Needless to say we did not go back for the entire two weeks we were there. The wait staff had no interest in our table even after we asked a couple of times. We actually looked for another restaurant to move to but Sunday afternoons are tough to find open places.

We stopped there for lunch on a Sunday. it was THREE hours to get service and get food. Needless to say we did not go back for the entire two weeks we were there. The wait staff had no interest in our table even after we asked a couple of times. We actually looked for another restaurant to move to but Sunday afternoons are tough to find open places.

Hotel is run down to the point of being unhealthy. I was particularly disturbed by the central air conditioning system which it seems has not been maintained in years. You could see huge amounts of dust and muck gathering around the vents and grills. The air in the room was heavy with dust particles and smelled awful. Noisy ceiling fan noisy toilet bathroom fixtures loud construction noise on the outside day and night made it pretty difficult to relax in room. Staff hospitality was a hit or miss with some great and others clearly depressed demotivated and not caring less about being there. Decent food was probably the only saving grace but you get no information upon check in about what the dining options times are. Had to figure this out on our ownwil not be going back and will not recommend this place to anyone who desires any modicum of quality.

location it ’s ok. close to the cruise ship dock. No real access to any meaningful beach unles you take a bit of a hike. Rooms are good lack of elevators in one wing of the hotel. I think there were two things that really disappointed me. food is horrible and service in the restaurant is lengthy and terrible. Staff behavior was very inconsistent. There were a couple good folks but the interaction with most of them were very disappointing. I recorded a lot of misinformation through y entire stay.

There were a couple good folks but the interaction with most of them were very disappointing. I recorded a lot of misinformation through y entire stay.
They are always booked solid and the food is always good. However the new staff needs training on customer service please.

Very disappointing The guys on the door looking after luggage were very helpful though. The location on the sea was lovely but being in the town was not pleasingly the traffic is manic and the hotel was difficult to get to. The building work on the hotel was dirty and noisy so we had to use a side entrance. As I had injured my ankle I asked if we could have a room nearer reception and the restaurant. We were told no by the receptionist who showed no sympathy at all. So I had to carry a heavy bag through to the other wing of the hotel up two flights of stairs one step at a time because of the pain and the lift was out of order. Then repeat the process to eat later on. We had a meal in the Palisades on our last night and we waited one hour for our food in spite of reminders. We were tired and exhausted.
